page.title: 05Farming in the Blackdowns
page.content: The land is maninly grade 3 often with thin soiled steep sloping fields,above average rainfall causes more silage to be made than hay harvested,though lack of sun may reduce sugar content of silage.Most farmhouses were built during the peak of prosperity in mid 19th century.Farming has been declining since,apart from during two world wars when German submarines prevented the import of cheap food from the Dominions.In 1947 farmers were actively exhorted to build up cow herds, mainly Friesian to produce milk for the Nation especially free milk to school children. On the Blackdowns mixed farming was general,cows,sheep arable,oats,wheat,barley, deeplitter hens, Christmas birds using available outbuildings joining local egg co-ops giving employment as packers locally.
